module.name: nearBlobber
module.description: Extracts brightest blob in a gray image
module.copypolicy: Released under the terms of the GNU GPL v2.0
module.description-long: This module takes as input a grayscale image and outputs the brightest blob both as a binary image and as an extracted rectangular crop around it, plus the blob centroid's coordinates and approximated area.
module.arguments: name robot imH imW <param desc="[auto|] side of the extracted crop. If it is an the crop is a square region around the blob's centroid. If it is set to 'auto' the crop encloses the blob's shape." default="auto"> cropSize margin backgroundThresh frontThresh minBlobSize gaussSize imageThreshRatioLow imageThreshRatioHigh

input.description:
Takes the following RPC commands from Human or stateMachine
-# margin (int) margin: sets the margin (in pixels) that the ROI keeps around the closest blob.") -# thresh (int) high (int) low : sets higher and lower luminosity bounds (0-255) that are considered: blobs with luminosity outside this range are not considered. -# help - produces this help.; -# quit - closes the module.;

output.description: Coordinates of the blob's centroid and approximated area.
Cropped region around the selected blob.
